title: Ticket #7767: condor_shadow activate/deactivates claim with wrong privilege
description:
PR#124

Report from OSG is that, if all the schedd has token (say, in /etc/condor/tokens.d/) and the CCB is necessary to talk to the starter, then the condor_shadow will invoke the activateClaim RPC with PRIV_USER.

Unfortunately, since the token is owned by PRIV_CONDOR, doing a RPC which involves going to the CCB results in a permission denied.

We should ensure the shadow always does RPCs to the starter as PRIV_CONDOR. So far, I've found activateClaim and deactivateClaim. There might be others..

2020-Aug-07 12:23:04 by zmiller:
Additional thought: Does this check for isDaemon() do the right thing inside DAGMan? Internally, DAGMan is daemonCore and has type SUBSYSTEM_CLASS_DAEMON, but it acts as a client (on behalf of the user) when talking to the SchedD to do "direct submit" or to update job attributes. So it should be using the user's tokens. set_priv(PRIV_CONDOR) is essentially a noop inside dagman because there's no UID switching, so probably it's fine.
